favorites.description: These are my favorite sites and content creators to feature in no particular order.

items.title: Overseer Cave
items.description: Made in FrontPage 2003!

items.title: DXD Tech
items.description: A very well made site, even if it's not oozing with early 2000s aesthetics.

items.title: PSNProfiles
items.description: Excellent crowd-sourced trophy guides for many games, helps me with actually completing games.

items.title: Completionist.me
items.description: Similar to PSNProfiles, but for Steam and RetroAchievements. Has a Kanban board for each game. Links to Steam Community Guides.

items.title: PCPartPicker
items.description: Excellent resource for finding the best price on PC hardware.

items.title: IsThereAnyDeal
items.description: Finds deals on PC games on authorized key merchants. Set up your wishlist to receive e-mail notifications when a game you want is on sale.

items.title: DekuDeals
items.description: Similar to IsThereAnyDeal, but for PlayStation 4 and 5 games in various retailers (Amazon, Target, etc).

items.title: PSDeals
items.description: PSDeals is a similar site that allows for browsing PS3 and PS Vita stores, as well as the modern consoles.

items.title: PSPrices
items.description: PSPrices is another similar site for all console and mobile platforms, but with a pricier premium subscription and a slightly worse UI.

items.title: Cathode Ray Dude
items.description: An amazing tech channel featuring interesting PCs, old A/V equipment, and weird software.

items.title: Linus Tech Tips
items.description: One of the largest tech channels, covering new products and all things tech.

items.title: Hardware Haven
items.description: Covering DIY homelab hardware and software on a budget.

items.title: Craft Computing
items.description: Covers DIY homelab hardware and software, as well as tutorials and product reviews.

items.title: Dawid Does Tech Stuff
items.description: Covers technology bought from weird marketplaces, as well as testing crazy ideas.

items.title: DankPods
items.description: Originally covering iPod modding, he's expanded into other topics, such as audio equipment and old technology.

items.title: Gamers Nexus
items.description: Covering computer hardware news weekly, as well as honest reviews about PC components.

items.title: Action Retro
items.description: Covering old computers and Macintoshes in the style of Druaga1.

items.title: Jeff Geerling
items.description: Covering Raspberry Pis and other Single-Board Computers, as well as DIY homelab hardware and software.

items.title: Snazzy Labs
items.description: Covering Apple products and honestly reviews technology.

items.title: Technology Connections
items.description: Covering technology in various products and tells how the technology works.

items.title: Techmoan
items.description: Covering old audio and video equipment, including rare and long-forgotten A/V formats.

items.title: Tech Tangents
items.description: Covering old computers and technology, as well as programming and preservation efforts.

items.title: clabretro
items.description: Covering old networking equipment from the likes of Cisco and Intel.

items.title: vinesauce
items.description: Not your typical variety game streamer. Vinny has several unique stream series, such as video game corruptions, awful plug & plays, and showcasing old commercials.

items.title: Rerez
items.description: Covering video games that are "Just Bad" to gaming hardware that's the "Worst Ever".

items.title: Auspicious Frog
items.description: Up and coming gaming YouTuber who covers niche subjects, like Plok, Rayman Legends' artstyle and Forgotten SNES Games.

items.title: DougDoug
items.description: Combines crazy stream ideas with the power of programming to create engaging, entertaining videos.

items.title: planet clue
items.description: Covers video games and electronics from the late 90s to early 2000s.

items.title: SimpleFlips
items.description: Combines Mario gameplay with romhacking and an excellent community.

items.title: Stop Skeletons From Fighting
items.description: Covers ambitious video game hardware to delisted digital-only games, each video deserves a popcorn bucket.

items.title: f4mi
items.description: Covers interesting technology and video game topics in a unique and engaging format.

items.title: Nick Robinson
items.description: Goes to extreme lengths to solve video game, anime, and pop culture mysteries.

items.title: gabi belle
items.description: Covering and analyzing modern social media trends.

items.title: YongYea
items.description: Covers video game industry news.

items.title: GameLinked
items.description: Covering video game news twice a week.

items.title: TechLinked
items.description: Covering technology news and gaming culture three times per week.

items.title: Gamers Nexus
items.description: Covering computer hardware news weekly.

items.title: Mystic
items.description: Covering PlayStation and games industry news weekly, as well as other PlayStation content.

items.title: brutalmoose
items.description: Used to cover video games, but has expanded into a variety of topics, such as food and movie reviews.

items.title: GLITCH
items.description: Indie animation channel with amazing webseries, such as Murder Drones and The Amazing Digital Circus.

items.title: MonkeyWrench
items.description: An indie animated webseries.
